title: UX Conference December Announced (Dec 7 - Dec 13)
description: Take up to 7 in-depth training courses, teaching user experience best practices for successful design. Courses focused on long-lasting skills for UX professionals. December 7- December 13, 2024.
excerpt: Take up to 7 in-depth training courses, teaching user experience best practices for successful design. Courses focused on long-lasting skills for UX professionals. December 7- December 13, 2024.
text: Course Schedule UX Certification Pricing FAQs December Virtual Training Schedule UX Certification Pricing FAQs Register Full-day live virtual courses about UX best practices, proven methods, and hands-on exercises led by NN/g experts and world-class invited speakers. Enjoy the comfort and convenience of your own office or home as you learn. Choose from 35 different UX topics. All courses are ﻿100% live interaction - no pre-recorded content. 2-way video conferencing for class discussions and Q&A with instructors Hands-on activities with collaboration tools with industry peers  Membership in the NN/g UX Slack Community, where you can connect with other digital professionals. (Permanent membership included with your registration.) Earn a UX Certificate online, at your own pace More about why you should attend  Time & Format Americas & EU Live Course sessions meet at San Francisco time 8 AM - 3 PM If you live in a different region, your meeting time would be: New York 11 AM - 6 PM São Paulo 12 PM - 7 PM London  4 PM - 11 PM Amsterdam/Berlin  5 PM -  12 AM Look Up Your Time Zone Each course takes place over a single day, lasting 7 hours (including breaks). Course Schedule  Course Schedule You can attend up to 7 courses, or just one — pay only for the courses you attend. UX Certification Attend and pass exams for any 5 courses to earn a UX Certificate. Participation in UX Certification is not required. Learn more about UX Certification. Optional Certification Specialities Interaction Management Research Pass at least 5 courses in one topic, and receive Specialty recognition on your UX Certificate. A specialty is not required to earn a UX Certificate. UX Certification Attend and pass exams for any 5 courses to earn a UX Certificate. Participation in UX Certification is not required. Learn more about UX Certification. Optional Certification Specialities Interaction Management Research Pass at least 5 courses in one topic, and receive Specialty recognition on your UX Certificate. A specialty is not required to earn a UX Certificate. (PM and PO) to better collaborate in product development Measuring UX and ROI Use metrics from quantitative research to demonstrate value Usability Testing Plan, conduct, and analyze your own studies, of your title Discovery: Building the Right Thing Conduct successful discovery phases to ensure you build the best solution Thursday, December 12 Thursday, December 12 Choose one: Designing Complex Apps for Specialized Domains Create and evaluate applications for advanced decision making, complicated workflows, and complex domains Information Architecture Organize and structure information to improve findability and discoverability Persuasive and Emotional Design Create delightful experiences that touch, convince, or excite your audience Design Tradeoffs and UX Decision-Making Enhance your sole UX professional in your organization with these strategies Friday, December 13 Friday, December 13 Choose one: Effective Ideation Techniques for UX Design Creative solutions for any UX design challenge UX Deliverables Effectively communicate ideas and findings to managers, collaborators, and other stakeholders. Inclusive and Equitable UX Understand unconscious biases to establish inclusive research and design practices ResearchOps: Scaling User Research Orchestrate and optimize research to amplify its impact UX Roadmaps Set a strategic, practical plan to align, prioritize, and communicate UX work. Get Help Choosing Courses: Select the category which describes you, and scroll up for highlighted course suggestions. UX Certification NN/g UX Certification is an exam-based credential which reinforces learning and increases your credibility. Earn a UX Certificate by attending any 5 courses, and passing the related exams. One exam for each course you attend Online exams can be completed the same day or up to 35 days later $80 USD administrative fee for each exam can be paid when your register or after attending Specialties are optional enhancements to the UX Certificate. If you pass a minimum of 5 courses in a Specialty, your UX Certificate will recognize your special expertise in that area. Take all 5 courses at a single training event, or gradually as your schedule permits, at different events. Course credit never expires.  Learn more about UX Certification Pricing  Pricing Save up to 20% Pay by the Course UntilNovember 15 UntilDecember 6 UntilDecember 13 1 Course $1105 $1155 $1205 2 Courses 10% off each $1989 $2079 $2169 3 Courses 15% off each $2818 $2945 $3073 4 Courses 18% off each $3624 $3788 $3952 5 Courses 20% off each $4420 $4620 $4820 6 Courses 20% off each $5304 $5544 $5784 7 Courses 20% off each $6188 $6468 $6748 Prices shown here are in U.S. Dollars (USD). Discounts are based on the number of courses purchased during the same event. If you choose to change your course enrollment after purchase, you may forfeit the discount and need to pay additional fees. Frequently Asked Questions  Frequently Asked Questions How will the Virtual Event work? Meetings will take place using the video conferencing tool Zoom, collaboration tools (such as group document editing and whiteboarding tools), and the social discussion tool Slack. You'll also be able to use Slack before, during, and after the event to participate in social events and network with other participants. What do I need in order to attend the virtual event? To participate in interactive live courses and exercises with other course participants, you will need: a stable high-speed internet connection, to stream audio and video to your computer speakers, a microphone, and a webcam (strongly recommended) a computer that does not have a strict firewall that blocks collaboration tools such as Miro and Google Docs. Zoom's meeting software (which is free to download and install), or Chrome browser What is the start and end time for courses? For this event, each full-day course will last for 7 hours including breaks. Start and end times are as follows:  Time Zone Course Session Starts Course Session Ends San Francisco  8 AM  3 PM New York City 11 AM  6 PM London  4 PM 11 PM Amsterdam/Berlin  5 PM 12 AM Look Up Your Time Zone Do I have to choose my sessions when I register? Yes. This not only speeds registration but also ensures you'll get a seat in the sessions you want. Can I get UX Certified at this event? Yes. Attend at least 5 courses and pass all 5 exams to earn an NN/g UX Certificate. You can take the 5 courses all at this event, or take some at this event and the rest at a future event.  How do exams work for UX Certification? You must sign in at the start of class, and attend the full day. At the end of the course each day, the online exam will be available for that day's classes. You will be able to log in, pay exam fees (if they were not already paid when you registered), and take the exam. You can take your exams the same day, or any time within 35 calendar days after the training event.  Payment Frequently Asked Questions Which payment methods are accepted? You may pay your tuition and exam fees by credit card, or bank transfer. The following credit cards are accepted: What discounts are available? There is a built-in discount for each additional day you attend. You can also take advantage of our early bird registration discount (as indicated in the pricing matrix on the event agenda page). If I register but then cannot attend, will I receive a refund? If you must cancel after registering, your registration fee will be refunded less a 20% handling fee, provided that written notice of cancellation is received by November 22, 2024. After that, no refunds will be granted, but we will accept a substitute attendee if we receive a written note from the registered attendee stating his or her intention to transfer registration to a named individual. Email events@nngroup.com with cancellation, substitution, or refund requests.  Is it safe for me to register using my credit card on the NN/g site? Absolutely. Our website uses Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) technology to encrypt your personal information when you place your order. This means that your order cannot be read as it travels over the Internet, so your name, address, and credit card information are secure.  I get an error when I try to register, can you help me? If you receive an error message when you try to register, restarting your browser may resolve the issue. You can also contact us at events@nngroup.com or +1(415) 685-4230 and we will be happy to assist you.  The Terms and Conditions for the UX Training and UX Certification Program provide more detailed information about policies, privacy, and the Code of Conduct for training participants.  More questions? Please contact us at events@nngroup.com or +1(415) 685-4230

  • Register

Full-day live virtual courses about UX best practices, proven methods, and hands-on exercises led by NN/g experts and world-class invited speakers. Enjoy the comfort and convenience of your own office or home as you learn.

  • Choose from 35 different UX topics. All courses are ﻿100% live interaction - no pre-recorded content.
  • 2-way video conferencing for class discussions and Q&A with instructors
  • Hands-on activities with collaboration tools with industry peers 
  • Membership in the NN/g UX Slack Community, where you can connect with other digital professionals. (Permanent membership included with your registration.)
  • Earn a UX Certificate online, at your own pace
  • More about why you should attend

 Time & Format

Americas & EU
Live Course sessions meet at

San Francisco time 8 AM - 3 PM

If you live in a different region, your meeting time would be:
New York 11 AM - 6 PM
São Paulo 12 PM - 7 PM
London  4 PM - 11 PM
Amsterdam/Berlin  5 PM -  12 AM
Look Up Your Time Zone

Each course takes place over a single day, lasting 7 hours (including breaks).

Course Schedule

 Course Schedule

You can attend up to 7 courses, or just one — pay only for the courses you attend.

UX Certification

Attend and pass exams for any 5 courses to earn a UX Certificate. Participation in UX Certification is not required. Learn more about UX Certification.

Optional Certification Specialities

  • Interaction
  • Management
  • Research

Pass at least 5 courses in one topic, and receive Specialty recognition on your UX Certificate. A specialty is not required to earn a UX Certificate.

UX Certification

Attend and pass exams for any 5 courses to earn a UX Certificate. Participation in UX Certification is not required. Learn more about UX Certification.

Optional Certification Specialities

  • Interaction
  • Management
  • Research

Pass at least 5 courses in one topic, and receive Specialty recognition on your UX Certificate. A specialty is not required to earn a UX Certificate.

Saturday, December 7

Saturday, December 7

Choose one:

    The Human Mind and Usability

    Use psychology to predict and explain how your customers think and act

    Journey Mapping to Understand Customer Needs

    Capture and communicate UX insights across complex interactions

Sunday, December 8

Choose one:

    Design Thinking Essentials

    Unearth user pain points to drive breakthrough design concepts

    Becoming a UX Executive

    Lead and manage UX at the executive level

Monday, December 9

Choose one:

    Practical AI for UX Professionals

    Leverage artificial intelligence tools to enhance your UX work and save valuable time

    UX Basic Training

    Foundational concepts that everyone should know

    Web Page UX Design

    Strategically combine content, visuals, and interactive components to design successful web pages

    Facilitating UX Workshops

    Lead goal-based group activities to make decisions and establish alignment

    Lean UX and Agile

    Strategies to stay user-centered in fast-paced Agile environments

    Analytics and User Experience

    Study your users’ real-life behaviors and make data-informed design decisions

    Create, maintain, and utilize personas throughout the UX design process

Tuesday, December 10

Choose one:

    Application Design for Web and Desktop

    DesignOps: Scaling UX Design and Research

    Define, share, and implement design operations

    Product and UX: Building Partnerships for Better Outcomes

    Understand UX and product roles (PM and PO) to better collaborate in product development

    Measuring UX and ROI

    Use metrics from quantitative research to demonstrate value

    Usability Testing

    Plan, conduct, and analyze your own studies, whether in person or remote

Wednesday, December 11

Wednesday, December 11

Choose one:

    Emerging Patterns in Interface Design

    Increase design quality, consistency, and efficiency

    Successful Stakeholder Relationships

    Get buy-in, manage expectations, and build trust

    UX Leader: Essential Skills for Any UX Practitioner

    Apply practical leadership skills to your UX role, regardless of your title

    Discovery: Building the Right Thing

    Conduct successful discovery phases to ensure you build the best solution

Thursday, December 12

Choose one:

    Create and evaluate applications for advanced decision making, complicated workflows, and complex domains

    Information Architecture

    Persuasive and Emotional Design

    Leading Highly Effective UX Teams

    Service Blueprinting

    Orchestrate people, props, and processes that are core to your digital experience

    Analyzing Qualitative UX Data and Reporting Insights

    Apply systematic analyses to uncover themes and user insights

    The One-Person UX Team

    Maximize your impact as the sole UX professional in your organization with these strategies

Friday, December 13

Friday, December 13

Choose one:

    Effective Ideation Techniques for UX Design

    Creative solutions for any UX design challenge

    UX Deliverables

    Effectively communicate ideas and findings to managers, collaborators, and other stakeholders.

    Inclusive and Equitable UX

    Understand unconscious biases to establish inclusive research and design practices

    ResearchOps: Scaling User Research

    Orchestrate and optimize research to amplify its impact

    UX Roadmaps

    Set a strategic, practical plan to align, prioritize, and communicate UX work.

Get Help Choosing Courses:

Select the category which describes you, and scroll up for highlighted course suggestions.

UX Certification

NN/g UX Certification is an exam-based credential which reinforces learning and increases your credibility. Earn a UX Certificate by attending any 5 courses, and passing the related exams.

  • One exam for each course you attend
  • Online exams can be completed the same day or up to 35 days later
  • $80 USD administrative fee for each exam can be paid when your register or after attending
  • Specialties are optional enhancements to the UX Certificate. If you pass a minimum of 5 courses in a Specialty, your UX Certificate will recognize your special expertise in that area.
  • Take all 5 courses at a single training event, or gradually as your schedule permits, at different events. Course credit never expires. 

Learn more about UX Certification

 Pricing

Frequently Asked Questions

 Frequently Asked Questions

How will the Virtual Event work?

Meetings will take place using the video conferencing tool Zoom, collaboration tools (such as group document editing and whiteboarding tools), and the social discussion tool Slack.

You'll also be able to use Slack before, during, and after the event to participate in social events and network with other participants.

What do I need in order to attend the virtual event?

To participate in interactive live courses and exercises with other course participants, you will need:

  • a stable high-speed internet connection, to stream audio and video to your computer
  • speakers, a microphone, and a webcam (strongly recommended)
  • a computer that does not have a strict firewall that blocks collaboration tools such as Miro and Google Docs.
  • Zoom's meeting software (which is free to download and install), or Chrome browser

What is the start and end time for courses?

For this event, each full-day course will last for 7 hours including breaks. Start and end times are as follows: 

Time Zone Course Session Starts Course Session Ends
San Francisco  8 AM  3 PM
New York City 11 AM  6 PM
London  4 PM 11 PM
Amsterdam/Berlin  5 PM 12 AM

Look Up Your Time Zone

Do I have to choose my sessions when I register?

Yes. This not only speeds registration but also ensures you'll get a seat in the sessions you want.

Can I get UX Certified at this event?

Yes. Attend at least 5 courses and pass all 5 exams to earn an NN/g UX Certificate. You can take the 5 courses all at this event, or take some at this event and the rest at a future event. 

How do exams work for UX Certification?

You must sign in at the start of class, and attend the full day. At the end of the course each day, the online exam will be available for that day's classes. You will be able to log in, pay exam fees (if they were not already paid when you registered), and take the exam. You can take your exams the same day, or any time within 35 calendar days after the training event. 

Payment Frequently Asked Questions

Which payment methods are accepted?

You may pay your tuition and exam fees by credit card, or bank transfer.

The following credit cards are accepted:

What discounts are available?

There is a built-in discount for each additional day you attend. You can also take advantage of our early bird registration discount (as indicated in the pricing matrix on the event agenda page).

If I register but then cannot attend, will I receive a refund?

If you must cancel after registering, your registration fee will be refunded less a 20% handling fee, provided that written notice of cancellation is received by November 22, 2024. After that, no refunds will be granted, but we will accept a substitute attendee if we receive a written note from the registered attendee stating his or her intention to transfer registration to a named individual. Email events@nngroup.com with cancellation, substitution, or refund requests. 

Is it safe for me to register using my credit card on the NN/g site?

Absolutely. Our website uses Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) technology to encrypt your personal information when you place your order. This means that your order cannot be read as it travels over the Internet, so your name, address, and credit card information are secure. 

I get an error when I try to register, can you help me?

If you receive an error message when you try to register, restarting your browser may resolve the issue. You can also contact us at events@nngroup.com or +1(415) 685-4230 and we will be happy to assist you. 

The Terms and Conditions for the UX Training and UX Certification Program provide more detailed information about policies, privacy, and the Code of Conduct for training participants. 

More questions?

Please contact us at events@nngroup.com or +1(415) 685-4230
